issue.title: Code is lost when assigning to object at runtime
Rollup incorrectly eliminates conditions on object properties set through 'this'
issue.body:
<!--
  ‚ö°Ô∏è katchow! We üíõ issues.

  Please - do not - skip or remove parts of this template.
  Or your issue may be closed.

  üëâüèΩ Need help or tech support? Please don't open an issue!
  Head to https://gitter.im/rollup/rollup or https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/rollupjs

  ‚ù§Ô∏è Rollup? Please consider supporting our collective:
  üëâ https://opencollective.com/rollup/donate
-->

- Rollup Version: 0.66.2
- Operating System (or Browser): Reproducible in Repl on Chrome 69 Win
- Node Version: N/A (Repl)

### How Do We Reproduce?

<!--
  Issues without minimal reproductions will be closed! Please provide one by:
  1. Using the REPL at https://rollupjs.org/repl, or
  2. Work to isolate the problem and provide the exact steps in this issue, or
  3. Provide a minimal repository link (Read https://git.io/fNzHA for instructions).
     These may take more time to triage than the other options.
-->

https://rollupjs.org/repl?version=0.66.2&

### Expected Behavior
Logic in `hideIfActive` is preserved, as there are valid situations where `o.active` would be `true`.  
E.g: if `show()` is called first.

### Actual Behavior
`hideIfActive` is emptied, which breaks the logic (now you can't hide `o` when it's active).

  be provided. In that situation, please add your code below using

-->

issue.title: False positive constant (tree shaking)

body: @lukastaegert This looks like it's probably still valid. Thoughts?
Definitely, and definitely critical. Fixing this is prerequisite for starting work on object member tree-shaking. I actually hope to start rather sooner than later on this.

issue.title: Tree shaking removing valid code
issue.body:

- Operating System (or Browser): Mac
- Node Version: 8

### How Do We Reproduce?

https://rollupjs.org/repl/?version=1.20.3&

<!--
  Issues without minimal reproductions will be closed! Please provide one by:
  1. Using the REPL at https://rollupjs.org/repl/, or
  2. Work to isolate the problem and provide the exact steps in this issue, or
  3. Provide a minimal repository link (Read https://git.io/fNzHA for instructions).
     These may take more time to triage than the other options.
-->


### Expected Behavior

`if (x.a) {` should not be removed

### Actual Behavior

it is

<!--
  Most issues can be expressed or demonstrated through the REPL or a repository.
  However, the situation may arise where some small code snippets also need to
  be provided. In that situation, please add your code below using
  Fenced Code Blocks (https://help.github.com/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks/)
-->

body:
As this is a pressing issue and it will still take some time until I get to properly reworking the foundations of this, I would be open to a pull request for a non-invasive quick fix, even though that might neuter side-effect tracking for object methods.

The quick fix could be:
At the moment, each call expression deoptimizes all call arguments because we do not know if a function call might mutate some of them. When the callee is a MemberExpression, additionally deoptimizing the callee should solve the issue. This would be consistent with treating `this` as an additional parameter, which basically it is.

I should not be necessary to do anything for usages of `.call`, `.apply` or `.bind` as in all these situations, the object that will become `this` is already a call parameter and therefore properly deoptimized.

issue.title: Object property has been treated as invariable value even it has been muted in method [treeshaking]
issue.body:
<!--
  ‚ö°Ô∏è katchow! We üíõ issues.

  Please - do not - remove this template.
  Please - do not - skip or remove parts of this template.
  Or your issue may be closed.

  üëâüèΩ Need help or tech support? Please don't open an issue!
  Head to https://gitter.im/rollup/rollup or https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/rollupjs

  ‚ù§Ô∏è Rollup? Please consider supporting our collective:
  üëâ https://opencollective.com/rollup/donate
-->

- Rollup Version: 1.25.2 and 1.2.x 
- Operating System (or Browser): Mac OS X
- Node Version: 8.10.x

looks like the bug has existed since v1.

### How Do We Reproduce?

input code
```js
var obj = {
  prop: null,
  setProp(value) { this.prop = value }
}

obj.setProp(123)

function output() {
  if (obj.prop) {
    var a = 3
    var b = 4
    return a + b
  }
  return -1
}

console.log(output())
```

bundle it with rollup with `treeshake` option on, it will be bundled as following content

output
```js
var obj = {
  prop: null,
  setProp: function setProp(value) { this.prop = value; }
};

obj.setProp(123);

function output() {
  return -1
}

console.log(output());
```
Even I config `treeshake.propertyReadSideEffects` to `true`, it still bundled as the following. 

<!--
  Issues without minimal reproductions will be closed! Please provide one by:
  1. Using the REPL at https://rollupjs.org/repl/, or
  2. Work to isolate the problem and provide the exact steps in this issue, or
  3. Provide a minimal repository link (Read https://git.io/fNzHA for instructions).
     These may take more time to triage than the other options.
-->

### Expected Behavior

the expressions in the `output` function shouldn't be optimized and erased.

### Actual Behavior

the condition `obj.prop` should be `123` instead of `null` since it's muted by `obj.setProp` method. but rollup still treat it as an invariable value then erased the code under the condition.

<!--
  Most issues can be expressed or demonstrated through the REPL or a repository.
  However, the situation may arise where some small code snippets also need to
  be provided. In that situation, please add your code below using
  Fenced Code Blocks (https://help.github.com/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks/)
-->

issue.title: workaround for various object literal mutation bugs
issue.body:

- [ ] other

Are tests included?

- [x] yes (*breaking changes will not be merged unless absolutely necessary*)

List any relevant issue numbers:

#2345 #2473 #3027 #3093 #3192 #3264

### Description

Workaround for various object literal mutation bugs.

Some necessary minor regressions related to previously unsafe object literal optimizations.

Fixes #2345 #2473 #3027 #3093 #3192 #3264
